meanings.definition: Measuring a certain distance from one side to the other, especially in comparison to other objects.
meanings.sent1: The thickest book on the shelf was hard to lift.
meanings.sent2: The tree trunk was the thickest among all the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The thickest sandwich I've ever seen was taller than a tower!
meanings.sent4: Her glasses had the thickest lenses, making her eyes look huge.
meanings.sent5: The thickest fog rolled in, hiding everything from view.

meanings.definition: Having a large amount of something, such as a dense forest.
meanings.sent1: The thickest part of the jungle was full of exotic birds.
meanings.sent2: The thickest layer of icing made the cake taste extra sweet.
meanings.sent3: She wore the thickest coat to stay warm in the snow.
meanings.sent4: The thickest crowd gathered to watch the parade.
meanings.sent5: The thickest soup she ever made was a hit at the potluck.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of 'thick', indicating the greatest degree of thickness.
meanings.sent1: The thickest of all the blankets kept him warm on cold nights.
meanings.sent2: The thickest in the stack of papers turned out to be the most important.
meanings.sent3: He claimed the thickest slice of cake for himself.
meanings.sent4: The thickest of friendships can withstand any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The thickest of fog made it impossible to see beyond a few feet.
